title: Fearless cat kills venomous copperhead snake which snuck into 81-year-old man's kitchen
text:
A copperhead snake was left dead after getting a taste of ‘claw enforcement’ from a cat who protected her 81-year-old owner from the unwanted venomous intruder.

The incident took place in Speedwell, Tennessee last week, where Jimmie Nelson lives with Shelly, his adopted shelter cat.

Nelson says he heard a noise in the middle of the night. At the time, he thought it was just Shelly being playful.

Two days later, however, he realized what the commotion was about.

Shelly (left) the shelter cat protected her owner and killed a venomous copperhead snake (right) last week

The snake (above) snuck into the home last week of Jimmie Nelson of Speedwell, Tennessee

Nelson, 81, heard a noise late at night but didn't think much of it. A couple of days later, he noticed the dead snake on his kitchen floor

‘I got out and looked under the table and there laid a snake,’ Nelson told WBIR-TV.

A copperhead snake, a venomous breed of snakes, slithered its way into Nelson’s kitchen.

Luckily for Nelson, who has trouble moving because of a stroke, Shelly was there to protect him.

‘On the side of the snake's neck and head there were claw marks and one big slash, so we knew right then that the cat had definitely killed the snake and then brought it out a few days later to show it to her little dad,’ said Teresa Seals, Nelson’s daughter.

Seals said that when her mother was alive, she didn’t allow her husband to bring a cat into the house.

Nelson, who lives alone after his wife died, wanted a cat as a companion

Now that Jimmie Nelson lives on his own, he wanted a cat as a companion.

‘He loves her, he doesn't wanna act like he pays attention but I've caught him actually petting and loving on her,’ Seals said.

‘I think the Lord sent the cat to us to save my dad...It was predestined for him to have this cat just to save his life.’

Nelson said that this was the first time in 60 years that a snake managed to get inside his house.

‘I've killed a million copperhead and rattlesnakes here on the place, but that was the one time it was close,’ said Nelson.
description: The incident took place last week in Speedwell, Tennessee, where Jimmie Nelson lives with Shelly, his adopted shelter cat. A dead copperhead snake was found on Nelson's kitchen floor.
